text: Nordstromia bicostata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1912. Note: This source gives 1911 as the year of description. It is found in Sikkim in India, Sichuan in China, Nepal and northern Myanmar. The wingspan is about 28 mm. The forewings are pale violaceous brown with red-brown antemedial and postmedial patches on the costa, the former with a slightly incurved fulvous line from it to the inner margin. There is an oblique fulvous subterminal line and the costal area towards the apex, the termen and cilia to vein 3 are all suffused with red- brown. The hindwings are ochreous yellow, the inner area greyish with a fulvous postmedial bar.Journal of the Bombay Natural History Society 21 (4): 1272 ==Subspecies== *Nordstromia bicostata bicostata (India, Nepal, Myanmar) *Nordstromia bicostata opalescens (Oberthür, 1916) (China: Sichuan) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1912 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nordstromia bicostata
